text: Employees sitting all behind the counters and no one seem to know what was going on. Been doing business there for a few years but wont be buying anything g else there.

name: Danny Ayala
text: Girlfriend paid for the extra coverage/furniture insurance on her couches and dining set. Upon delivery, table was damaged when moving it to the dining room. OK... Then stools last a few weeks before the got wobbly, and the braces that held the seat to the stool broke off and a dowel broke off making the seats totally unstable. This happened to 2 seats. Took the stools back to be replaced or repaired, as stated with the extra coverage, and they said the tools to fix it haven’t came in yet. It’s been over 6 months! And there’s a Marvin’s 3 stores down! Also, we took back a seat cushion that was ruined (zipper broke off) and that hasn’t been replaced yet either. Stores weren’t shut down in March so they can’t blame the delay on that. If you buy from here, don’t waste your money paying for the extras like extra coverage on your furniture. They’re just trying to make some extra money with no real plan on how to honor that promise.

name: Barry Lewis
text:
I know that places like Walmart Stores have been here for many years. I am an old hippie and old school school . Just personally the mom and pop have faded into history....I don't think I am the only human that has noticed the extinction of days gone by"Mom&Pop"stores. Most people don't like change...I know to survive in the era of technology the human equation has to change or get left out and sadly we have to adapt to a different environment. Don't take my bicentennial moments of rambling that seriously . I will say that my experience at Walmart today was very good.  More particular is that my squirrels and varieties of birds are really happy! Once again share stories and dine on songbird seeds that I purchased can not be found locally except Walmart or Amazon online.
Tonight's movie is a classic titled [Don't Bend Over In The Pea Patch cause Them Taters have Eyes]"FILM AT 11:00PM

text: They rescheduled our appointment 3 times, ongoing three and half weeks. The second time they sent someone unqualified to do the job and technician lied saying someone would come the same day of the second appointment. My father is diabetic and needs his fridge to keep insulin cold. I was hung up on and disrespected by a so called supervisor. No wonder they are going out of business all over the place. Piss poor customer service. My fathers health is at risk and these people don’t care. I will be filing a complaint with the BBB, FTC and the state AG. They shouldn’t even earn one star.

text: We had an issue with one of our Walker mowers and we put in in the shop 3 different times and they kept throwing parts at it and never fixed it. We were out $1000 and still had the same issue. They kept saying they were “doing what the manufacturer recommended” but it obviously did not help.

name: Brian Balch
text: I am a local landscape contractor.  Nelson has been the only local source for the equipment we use, and we bought two machines from them..  We have had several warranty issues come up, and on a few occasions I have had to fight Nelson over "shop fees" on the warranty work.  Now as I write this, yet again we had a warranty problem and the shop worked on the machine.  The shop left some bolts out during the repair which has since caused further damage to the machine.  We took the machine back and showed them what had been left off and were told well maybe we will do better next time.  So after trying to fix the problem ourself, without success, we took it back again, and Nelson is telling me they will be charging a shop fee to fix what they basically broke.  I have had this same exact problem with them time and time again... and for this reason... I will no longer do business with E A Nelson.  Crooks in my book..

name: Chris Jackson
text: Yes Mike had a customer in there who was looking for a starter and he calls me and asked me which starter it was I tried to explain to him yet he interrupts me stating that "he has only been working on small engines 20+ years" then hangs up on me! Well Mike if you have been working on small engines 20+ years why did you call me to begin with? Not professional and not 20+ years worth of knowledge in my book!

name: Phillip Hale
text:
Terrible store. You’ve got order pickup spots taken up by people who aren’t picking online orders up, people rolling carts in random directions(literally hitting other peoples cars), trash all across the parking lot. Cops parked outside but not enforcing road laws. Sitting in 95+ degree heat waiting for people to do their job and bring bags to the car. People want 15/hr. But can’t do the simplest part of their job.

Walmart should go ahead and shut this one down. Not worth the money to upkeep, paying employees to not do their job. Trash.

name: Tim spradlin
text: Good place to get your lawn mower work on

name: Alexander Lee
text: Tim was great in getting my weed eater running within a few days  like it was brand new.. highly recommend

name: Dennis C. Latham
text: Well ... It's no longer going by that name... I was so distracted by the wonderful NEW OWNER and his pleasant professionalism, and knowledge on the help I needed.... I didn't think to see if it had a new name or the old name ......

name: John Hermann
text:
Folks, there are 2 types of technicians out there. -There are techs who fully understand what they are working on, properly diagnose the issue and fix it.-Then there is this guy, a parts thrower. Throwing parts at something with “educated” guesses hoping it fixes it.
Not only was his show room bare empty (red flag 1), he cuts me off mid- sentence (red flag 2) upon first meeting him. Then suggests I lie (red flag 3) to marvins and don’t tell them that I dropped my brand new saw 20 feet to the ground resulting in its current running condition..
Now, being a traveling master tech myself I am on an extreme time crunch. I hand the saw to him and tell him to fix it.
3 days later, he called me telling me it’s fixed. “Cool, what was it?” I asked him. He said that the fuel line in the tank was torn, so he replaced it. He states that he also replaced the fuel filter, the spark plug, and cleaned the carburetor (red flag 4-7).
Keep in mind folks that this saw had maybe 10 minutes run time on it before I dropped it.
“Huh, weird. I’ll be by Saturday to pick it up”.
Saturday rolls around, I hand him a crisp $100 bill and get my saw back reassured again that it is fixed.
-I get back to my house, try to fire the saw, it fires but runs like garbage for about 5 seconds then dies. Won’t start again. I then hop onto google and read some reviews on this place. No way am I going to bother calling him or bring it back.
A month later, I finally have a day off and time to diagnose my saw. Ignition coil was cracked and it was grounding itself out losing spark. It also had a small intake leak I assume was from him taking the saw apart, and I adjusted my carb a bit. I am not convinced any parts listed above were even changed..
My saw now runs great; because I am the first kind of technician I described above. This guy is the second kind. He is the kind that gives real techs like me a bad reputation due to his parts throwing and lies. I strongly suggest not using him for any real mechanical issues and instead hunt for a good professional tech.

name: Renee Chavers
text: Tried to buy a riding lawnmower from these people today. Was paying cash. After saying they deliver in Millbrook, they then told me that they couldn't deliver to me. I live exactly 3.2 miles from them and I'm well within Millbrook city limits. Clearly, they don't need business. I highly, highly recommend spending your money literally anywhere else.

text:
I brought my motorcycle to them for wheel bearings, brake pads and tires... you know, day one techschool stuff. They had my bike for 3 months and neglected to drain the carb or keep it on a battery tender. So now I need to clean the carb and get a new battery. When I got my bike back, the front brakes no longer worked and the front fork seals no longer held air pressure, so now I need new seals and a master cylinder. They put brand new tires on the wheels but left the old valve stems, so the wheels go flat overnight now.

I brought the bike to them with the saddlebags, trunk, crash guards, chrome trim, antennas, lights, trailer hitch and seat already removed so they wouldn't have to deal with any of that. I brought them all the necessary parts except the tires. All they had to get was the tires. They still had my bike for 3 months and tried to charge me over $600 for their half assed bullshittery. They ended up settling for $575 cash.

DO NOT, UNDER ANY CIRCUMSTANCES, BRING A MOTORCYCLE TO THESE IDIOTS

name: Thorn J
text: I took my friend here for their Black Friday sale. We entered, an employee was sitting at the table and didn't get up, not even to greet us or read the advertisement - in front of an elderly woman with a cane. We asked to see the Nintendo Switch Lite; she brought us the Switch (the original). We asked to see the gray Nintendo Switch Lite, she brought us the blue. Took a few more tries to get the gray one and she took as much time as possible to bring these to us, even though they were mere steps behind her. She tells us they are $399 - the price of the original Switch. I show her that Nintendo themselves sells the Switch Lite for $199. Her response? "We don't price match here." I'm sorry, you don't price match the manufacturer? You're really going to have the audacity to charge twice the manufacturer's price even when confronted about your dishonesty? If you like being scammed and your intelligence insulted by the employee's inability to do basic elementary-level math, look no further than this predatory hellscape. The store itself reeks of ingenuine intentions and cheap carpeting.

text: Do NOT buy from Farmers. It is a scam.  Overpriced furniture, extreme interest rates and $4 Charge for a phone payment because they haven’t set up online payments. It’s 2020; there is NO good reason to not offer an online payment option.  I don’t believe you “just haven’t set it up yet.”  This is your design to squeeze more money out of your customers.  I am trying to help a friend get out from under your thumb.  She will be wiser next time.  I will tell anyone who will listen not to buy anything from this store.

text: Farmer offers great customer service at the time of the purchase but after that service is downhill. After two months of having my couch the base board broke. It took 3 months for the manager to come fix it. After that the decorative pillows that came with the sectional began to rip at the corners of the pillow. It took 3 months to get a new pillow. I've have my couch for 9 months now and all of the decorative pillows are coming apart. I was told new ones would be ordered and be there in 5 days, its been three weeks now and records show nothing was ever ordered for me. There is a lack of communication between the manager and the person who orders new products. There is also a lack of concern for the satisfaction of the customer. I paid my furniture off within the first 6 months of owning it. I was going to go back to purchase more, but after this I will not be shopping at that location again. Good luck to those who do.

name: Kevin Clairmont
text: I don’t even know where to begin. I was on the road with my gas powered 2019 Ford Transit. On my way to delivery, my brakes started to growl badly. I called around and of course, most places need a day or two to get my truck brakes looked at and since I am an expeditor and live in my truck, I didn’t have the luxury of waiting. Thompson readily made themselves available to at least look at the problem and see if it’s something they can fix. The shop was swamped with work but Tim got Ben to begin working on it. All 4 brakes got new pads and rotors and in one case, a new caliper because of the neglect of a past brake job from another shop. A day and a half later, my truck was ready and so was I! I was pleasantly surprised when I saw the bill! Thompson set the bar high when it comes to fair pricing. I was shocked and eagerly paid my bill because I was expecting to pay so much more!! If I am in the area and need work done, Thompson is where I would go! Thank y’all at Thompson for your work and hospitality! If you’re looking for a competent mechanics with a hometown feel...you can’t go wrong with Thompson Tractor...I tip my cap and thank you for everything!!

name: Billy Robertson
text: First, my lawnmower only had 26 hours of usage, when the head gasket began to leak. Of course, this was not under warranty and the cost for repair is $284. Labor cost is $102 per hour. I dropped off my lawnmower on a Wednesday.  After calling to check on the status after a week, I was informed a few days later Of the total cost. And then took an additional two weeks for the repairs to be completed. In closing, it took 19 days to do two hours worth of work.  I was never notified nor updated.  When I picked up my lawnmower the only greeting I was met with was your total was $284.80. Terrible customer service, terrible communication and obviously an inferior product.

resp.text: Hi Billy --  we are very sorry you had a negative experience with our Florence dealership. Customer service is very important to us at TriGreen Equipment and we are going to forward these comments to management. We hope you'll consider giving us another try, please contact us directly at 256-233-0339 so we can work to make this right for you.

name: Scott Roysden
text:
Terrible service team !
I have a John Deere skid steer I took in with what seemed to be a hydraulic issue .
I left my machine in what I assumed would be capable hands .
After a few days I was told that it needed a pressure relief valve because the hydraulic pressure was low !!
Remember that statement while I write the rest of this review because it will come back to that !
The part came in and they told me it was ready . I drove an hr to pick up machine got in it and had the same issue as when I dropped it off .
Never got it on the trailer !!!
I left machine with them for yet another wrong diagnosis of bad hydraulic pump !
I got contacted that machine was ready so I picked it up . Still same issues but I needed it to continue with work . They had my machine for almost 2 weeks which is not a problem if I get back a fixed machine.
The repair cost was almost $4000 and machine was still the same as the day I took it .
So after a few weeks of trying the machine it never got better or worse so I knew I still had an issue !
I took it to a repair shop that I was referred to and after 3 hrs I got a call your machine is ready !!!
Exciting news and it was only a issue with computer it was stuck in a precision mode !!
Cost me $164 and the machine works great !!!
I called TRIGREEN and told them and they did absolutely nothing but tell me it needed the parts they installed! Remember the statement I referred to earlier ^ the next section tells you the answer !!

Now here is the kicker precision mode decreases hydraulic flow which was my issue and is exactly what TRIGREEN said but failed to check the obvious because they want to throw parts at your problem and run your bill up ! The parts they replaced was not necessary because it was just stuck in the wrong mode .
I have called corporate and they are sticking with the decision of the Florence store on not making this right .
I’m writing this to warn you off of using this company they are not customer service friendly and incompetent of working on the product they sale .
Hope this helps the next customer with there decision on buying or using this store for anything!!!

resp.text: Hi Scott -- we are certainly very sorry to hear that your experience with TriGreen has left you feeling angry and frustrated. We understand that we are not the intended audience for your review, but we value your feedback, nonetheless. Providing exceptional customer service is very important to us, and when we miss the mark with even one customer, we like to take it as an opportunity to improve. We stand by the work performed by our service departments, but we will communicate your comments to management and work with them to ensure our technicians are being effective and efficient in diagnosing and repairing our customers' equipment. We are very sorry that we seem to have lost your business, but most importantly we are very happy to hear that your skid steer is back in operation. If ever you want to discuss this further, feel free to contact us directly at 256-233-0339.

I just thought I had received bad service from other companies and people before, but in 64 years I have been naive. I left a mower for a carburator rebuild, was quoted 70$ and 20 for labor on a oil change as I already had the filter and oil. So the pricing was agreed to and I was told to call in a week.
When I called I was told that the bill was 300$. Then I made a horrible mistake, I asked him why he didn't call me before tripling the agreed to price. He said he wasn't capable of rebuilding the carburator and had to replace it. I said I didn't understand why I didn't get a phone call.
At that point I was told"I don't give a GD wether you come get it or not, the moth__ ___ker can sit outside till it rots for all I care." in a loud and clear way. NEVER AGAIN

text:
Not reputable, and certainly not customer-oriented! It took over seven months for a “warranty” claim to be processed, only to find out that my issue was not a warranted item (cracked shaft mount). And to make it even worse, I was the one who called (at the six month point of dropping it off, with no contact on their part) which initiated a call-back and “assessment” that the item was not repairable under warranty terms. I was charged a “diagnosis fee,” for them to pick up the phone and tell me such. I won’t ever be doing business with this dishonest organization.

Caveat: the older gentleman (owner?) and I had a conversation (he apologized), and it seemed to resonate that the administration was in disarray. I mentioned the words “lazy” and “trash” for treatment, and that exuded a response, as it should. I don’t wish to be contacted, as this organization has done plenty of “nothing” and masqueraded as doing everything (and charging me for it, nonetheless - it was a negligible amount in my opinion, but to them perhaps it’s the large amount they NEED and one that out of principle will keep me, colleagues, neighbors, etc. away).

#StepOffSoapBox

name: Andy C.
text: Brought in a Ryobi 40v string trimmer for warranty repairs, with the complaint being that it cut off after a short period of use (under 2 minutes), and once restarted would cut off immediately when put under load. They tried to give it back 4 times over a 2 month period, claiming there was no problem, and charged me a diagnostic fee, claiming diagnostics aren't covered for warranty work when there is no problem found. I took it apart at home, discovered that there was NO grease in the gearbox. Packed it with grease, and greased the output shaft as well. Less than a 30 minute job. Now it runs like a champ. I'll never darken their doorstep again. For the miles put on my car over 4 trips, I would have been better driving to Fayetteville or Cullman's warranty centers.

He said he had changed out everything he could possibly think of except the wiring harness and he was going to try that. He said if that doesn’t work then he couldn’t fix it. Said he’d know by Tuesday. Tuesday came and went with no call. Wednesday afternoon drove over and it still wasn’t done. He said his other worker didn’t come in so he’d look at it himself. Later that evening he called and said it was good to go. Communication was horrible! Service was horrible. The mower was there for a total of two weeks and he made it sound like it wasn’t fixable. Definitely will never take anything there ever again!

text: I got a great deal on a Z mower and I love it. Buying at Hedden was easy, fast and simple. The owner of Hedden was a fantastic guide to the mower, and answered or better yet, showed me answers to all my question. Really this is a 5 star company but I deducted one star because the owner did not follow up after the sale. I would have expected this had I purchased the mower at Lowes or Home Depot. Otherwise, I'm happy with Hedden and I will buy my next mower from them. Oh yeah, the guy that delivered my mower was great and very knowledgeable. Remember to buy local and support people in the near community.

name: James Holder
text: Called to price a new part didn’t give me a chance to tell her what all I needed wanted to charge 50 dollars in freight to order a mower deck for a rider.Told her I could order from Gravely direct and didn’t have to pay that amount for shipping needed to order about 300 dollars or so in parts but I will order direct because the young lady I talked to was short spoken and didn’t seem as if she wanted my business. I have purchased here before and had good service but not again.

resp.text: We are sorry for your experience.  We only pass along shipping that is charged to us.  We are sent mower decks by truck line and are charged by size, which is why this amount was higher than a normal freight charge for a parts order.  Again, we are sorry for your experience as we pride ourselves in giving great customer service.

This is a fantastic business, and all of my servicing and future equipment will be purchased from them.  If you are in the market for any new/used equipment, or if you need any existing equipment serviced, do yourself a favor and check out Hedden.

text: I personally have bought 2 mowers from Mark and I’m in the process of buying another mower. Also I have had over 10 bought by friends and family. I own a Lawncare business and anytime I’ve had a problem which isn’t very often he has always made sure that I haven’t been without a mower. This is another reason why I will always continue to go see Mark. These guys treat you like family. And that’s the kind of place I will continue to keep my business!!!! They have definitely earned a lifetime customer!!!!!

resp.text: We are sorry you are having trouble.  We do use impact when putting blades on for safety reasons.  If you want to bring your mower in, we will gladly get your blades off.

text:
They had lawn mower 1 week called to go pick up was told they were to busy and hadn't been able to work on it, said it will be done the following week,  called to pick up the second week and it still wasn't done. Had to pay $100 to have lawn care done. Finally 1 month later they said it was  done ✔ husband went to pick it up and it didn't start! Was told they don't understand why but will get right on it. Paid for lawn care again  $100! They called a week later said there was bad gas in in and they cleaned it out and did whatever else. A week later they call and complain that they need the room to come get it.  Husband is a truck driver he tried to pick it up but everytime he called they were either working on it or it wasn't done. We paid for lawn care again $100! Finally mower is done they offer to bring it and  tell us they are delivering in an hour. Got the money and didn't show! Next day husband called they said they were going to be here in 45 minutes.  2 and a half hours later I called and was  the person that answered was rude telling me they are busy, finally the lawnmower shows up! The driver "Lee" was extremely rude and had no apology for not coming when they said instead blamed all the problems on our mower! Including the gas going bad from sitting at the shop! We have done business with Sam's for years, NEVER AGAIN!
JUST TRIED TO MOW FRONT YARD, THE MOWER SMOKED AFTER 5 MINUTES! GREAT JOB!🤬🤬🤬

name: j silvey
text: Dropped of my son's go cart in May, for the to repair a sticking throttle. Checked in every couple weeks to be told soon, next week, may the week after. I get that places are busy, but it got to be way too long.6 months, SERIOUSLY! 6 MONTHS. Finally I drive there, in my car, they tell me they can't fix it, no parts for that kind of cart. Then was told the cart repair guy quit/fired. 6 months not a call, nothing. So, our neighbor goes and picks up the cart. These guys load it with a forklift. Onto her small trailer. Now we have a cart that went in for a sticking throttle, no repairs done, we get it back, with 2 flat tires, and wont start at all now, I'm sure from sitting in the storage lot out in the rain for 1/2 a year. If you have a cart there, y'all better call because they arent fixing anything. As a side note, was told I could pick the cart up on a Saturday, go up and a random handwritten sign says on vacation until October 18th. Could have mentioned that when we were there, or when we called to verify hours. Went the following Saturday, the 24th, OPEN sign is on, not a soul to be found. NO REPAIRS, NO COMMUNICATION, NO CUSTOMER SERVICE. HOW ON EARTH ARE YOU GUYS EVEN IN BUSINESS?

name: Danielle Silvey
text: TERRIBLE customer service!! Had our go kart for 8 months kept putting us off then FINALLY told us they couldn't fix it after 8 months!!  Then went TWICE to pick it up an they were closed  when we had called ahead of time an were told they were open!! Will NEVER go back there again!!! DO NOT RECOMMEND!!!

name: Cheshire Cat
text: I've been using Sam's for years, to do my yearly maintenance,  as well as any repairs my Husqvarna riding mowers have needed. They've ALWAYS done an excellent job at keeping them in top operating condition at a reasonable rate, with timely service. I recently had some issues with one of my mowers, that they repaired, but 10 minutes into mowing, it broke down again. Needless to say, I was upset, and called to speak to the manager. I explained my maintenance and repair record and that I felt if everything had been done correctly, I wouldn't be having these issues. He told me to bring it back, and he would see to it that I was taken care of. He was true to his word, and now I'm back on a like new machine. I understand that they've been very short handed and working long hours due to covid19,  and God knows nobody's perfect, but he handled this customer like a good, honest businessman should. And really,  that's 5 stars right there. Add to that, the great service I've always gotten there...I will continue to recommend Sam's Small Engine.

text: A call to Sam’s gave me the information and I took my push mower in for tuneup and repair. The cost was indeed in the window he gave me over the phone and a fair deal. The receipt is itemized. I’m taking my chainsaw there as Sam’s is now my go to place for small engine tool repairs.

name: Brian Dothan
text:
I bought a Stihl chainsaw from them and used it once. A year later it would not start. They told me it was no good and need to be replaced. WHAT???? It's a STIHL!!

I took it home. Add some Mystery Oil in the block and waited 24 hours. Then it start easily and has been running for 9 years.

Then they said the same thing about our generator which my employee took by there without my permission. They told him that the engine was no good and needed to be replaced.

I told my employee to take it to another small engine shop. it was a small repairs and NOT a bad engine. We used it after Hurrican Michael.

Never.. use Sams Small Engine

text: Great service for recently purchased auction mower. He did a great job of getting the service taking care of for me before I got there and had the unit ready to load when I showed up.

name: Tony Bass
text: I bought a tractor here a year ago because they are the closest Kubota dealer to where I live. I could have gotten a MUCH better deal from another dealer but I didn't want to drive over an hour if I needed parts. For this reason I was willing to overlook the salesman who had ZERO knowledge of tractors, had no idea what a flail mower was and couldn't tell me what features would justify the expense of one implement over the other. I was willing to ignore  the random mechanic who wandered onto the sales floor trying to talk me out of the machine I wanted even though he had no understanding of my needs. I also endured the pain of dealing with the rude and unwelcoming finance manager who had the personality of a shoe. All of this because of the promise of a good service department and the full coverage warranty through Kubota and KTAC which is supposed to cover EVERYTHING on the tractor. Fast forward a few months and it's time for a small part that broke. I went right to HMTC service dept only to find out that not only is the part not covered, but they don't even have the part in stock and will take a month to come in. Ok, chalk it up to bad luck. Another month or so later I head to HMTC again for simple parts and they have none in stock. This happened a total of 4 times and I finally give up. The management here is out of touch with the market and their customers. They refuse to hire competent, qualified employees. Even the lady and the front door acts like you're interrupting her day when you walk through the door. Never again will I do business with or recommend anyone to HMTC. I honestly hope they get bought out soon by someone who knows how to run a business and serve their customers.

text: Took our chainsaw for repair. The pull cord had come out. When picking it up the first time after repair when we tried to crank it there at the store the cord came out again. We were told a part was broken and needed to be ordered. After several days part had still not come in, so we rented a chainsaw from them. When the part came in and again went to pick up the chainsaw upon returning home tried the chainsaw again. After about 3 pulls the cord once again came out . Took the chainsaw back once again and was told we were the problem. Totally unprofessional.

text: The guys here are the best in town with the lowest prices. You just don't get that combination anymore. Mike helped me out with the best product for my job as well as the most competitive price in town. (I checked four other places) David was extremely knowledgeable when fixing my equipment. He gave me advice on where to go and what I needed for all my future and current maintenance. I will absolutely come back here for rentals, purchases or services on any small engine equipment. They also support the troops.

Scag mowers are unbelievably good!

name: Mark Deuschle
text: I bought a new Scag Tiger Cat 2 from CTE about a week ago. I have to say this was an excellent experience Michael was very helpful worked very hard to help me through out the entire time. I was looking and comparing the John Deere to the Scag not once he Michael put down the John Deere he showed me the man6 advantages the Scag had over the John Deere. I also very much appreciated the honesty and integrity he displayed which also is a big reason I chose the Scag, I was lied to by a salesman at John Deere at one dealership and another dealership I was told that he could sell me the mower for the price but he wouldn’t make much so he didn’t want to sell it, those 2 experiences alone helped me decide that my after the sale experience probably would be as sorry also. Michael helped me select a Scag which is a very high end and high quality machine there was no pressure just friendly service and a willingness to answer all my questions. I highly recommend purchasing from CTE and Michael. Great job you’ve earned a customer for life!

name: Foster Dickson
text: Very disappointed in their service department. I took a broken push mower, which ended up being beyond repair, but the counter man couldn't tell me what was done (or not done) to it because the mechanic's notes were vague and indecipherable. It cost me $50 and a three-week wait to get nothing, not even a solid explanation. Moreover, despite a citywide mask ordinance, no one was wearing a mask.

text:
I've done business with the crew at CTE  for many years and have never been disappointed. The attention to detail and service is paramount with them. I recently purchased a Land Master ATV from CTE. What a tank !. Perfect for hunting, farm work, etc....and it will go anywhere!
At half  the  price of  many ATVs it's a deal. It comes with a choice of name brand engines, hybrids or all electric. I chose a Honda and am very pleased.  CTE means quality!!!

text: Came in looking for a chainsaw. Talked to justin. He was very knowledgeable and assisted me in finding exactly what I needed. Also, I am embarrassed to say, the mower had a lot of grass clipping on the blade deck. It came back cleaned (they didn't have to do that, but it was really appreciated).

For those of us who do not have P/U trucks with trailers, their delivery service is a life saver.

Great friendly people, throughout the transaction.

I would never do business with them....not that they would want to anyway. CRAZY!

text:
The convict-looking tattood guy at the front desk didn't even speak to me; too busy surfing the web & drinking coffee. the other lady had a very poor & disgruntled attitude, like she was pissed off that she had to put down her cigarette out back to 'help' me.

Take your business elsewhere if you expect courtesy and professionalism. If you need a $800 push-mower then this is the place for you! I'll never spend a dime in this shop, even though I loved my CTE in Auburn & have done business there for ten years.  Shameful.

Even though good help is hard to find: I would pay the extra $1/hr for somebody who will treat customers with respect. I came in this store to PAY for a service & ended up ordering my parts online and doing it myself.

This bad experience would be forgivable if they were busy and booming, but this was not the case. Their staff were just lazy & rude & condescending.

name: David Raphael
text: Everyone from top to bottom at CTE are friendly and professional.  I had a warranty dispute with Briggs and Stratton about a problem with a new engine.  They told me to take it to and authorized B&S svc ctr.  CTE inspected the engine and reported their findings to B&S.  They explained my situation but warranty was denied by B&S.  I persisted for over a month and finally gave up in frustration.  I went to pick up my ruined machine and pay for the labor etc.  There was a little confusion as to how to handle the bill and a gentleman named, Bruce wanted to know what the story was with my mower.  It's a long one but he listened and  agreed that something was wrong.  He said leave it here, send him an email with the whole story and he'd make a few calls.  A week later he called and said B&S had reconsidered and was giving full compensation.  I couldn't believe it, as I am a rare customer.  I brought the mower home yesterday and saw a sign as I was leaving.  Bruce Holder was his name and he was the owner.  Now that is customer service from top to bottom!  I cannot give these folks any possible higher grade or praise.  So I bought them all donuts!  They have a customer for life with me.  I cannot recommend them enough.  Thanks all.

name: Rudy Banes
text: The 80+ dollars I spent on a tune up did not even include changing the spark plug. Probably the most expensive oil change I ever paid for (including automobiles). My lawnmower ran worse after I took it to them. I called and told them and they said to bring it back in. I tried explaining over the phone my problem, so that I wouldn't have to waste a trip. He kept cutting me off and saying to just bring it in. When I got there, he just talked down to me in front of the other customers and employees and said it was probably just from old, bad gas. Then he sent his largest idiot out to the parking lot with me to start it. After a few tries, he got it started and again said it was just bad gas. I asked how I could dispose of the gas and he told me to pour it on ant beds in my yard. I changed the gas out and realized they had not even changed the spark plug, which was black at this point. With fresh gas (including fuel stabilizer) and a new spark plug, it still runs worse than before I ever took it to them. Stay away from these condescending, knuckle-dragging, mouth breathing jerks who haven't even discovered fire yet.

name: ron goss
text: I took a Husquavarna chain saw in for repair . They said the turn around would be approx. 2 weeks . 9 days later I called them and they told me my saw was burned up and it would be cheaper to buy a new one than to repair the old one ( if they knew this why did they not call me ? ). I had a 18" saw and they sold me an 18" saw with less  horsepower than my old one . I took the new saw home with out knowing at the time it had less power than the old one , it did not do the job . I took the saw back and the older Gary said it did not have the power , I should get a 455 Huskie , which I did . I paid the difference or so I thought . BUT , the next day little Gary called me and said I owed them $43.00 more . Then I told him that you priced it , you wrote the ticket , and you're the one that charged my card , you made the mistake , come to my home and get your money , little Gary said it would take his whole lunch hour , I should bring the money to the store, yet it was his mistake . Then I told him I have a receipt and I am not paying , then he went into a rant how they would not service this saw or any thing else. After thinking about it, I went this morning and paid them the $43.00 they said I owed , shame on me . I will NEVER take anything to Gary's Small Motors on Harrison Road , nor will I EVER  BUY ANYTHING from them again . Little Gary needs to take some classes on customer service .

name: Taylor Norton
text:
First review I have ever felt compelled to write. I called eager to give the "local guy" a chance. When I called and was informed Mr. Donnelly was in the shower and asked if I could call back. I was taken aback. I asked if Mr. Donnelly would be willing to call me back (as I have no idea how long his showers take). To his credit he did promptly return my call. He however was not eager at all to work on my small engine stating stating; "35 hp is not for him".  I tried to explain that it was a minor switch repair which would be common sense to most mechanics and I just needed a little help and when I asked if I could at least bring it by for him to look at. He stated "no I am afraid you cannot" and hung up. No "try to call this guy or the next" just a dial tone. .
Now he maybe the best lawn mower repair guy in the world and maybe I caught him on a bad day, but he fell quite short of my expectations and my experience was not positive.

name: Melinda Bailey
text: We were very disappointed with the service. We brought our riding lawnmower in to be serviced and was charged $ 530 and got it home and started mowing and immediately started blowing black smoke. We were told to bring it back and they charged another $130 and then preceded to tell us that it would be an additional $1200 to replace the block that was worn out. Basically we spent $730 for unauthorized new parts to be told the lawnmower would not run without a new block. My suggestion to anyone that asks for repairs to be called with an estimate before you are charged for expensive parts that you did not authorize and do not even repair your mower. You don’t know until you get home and it doesn’t work and you are totally out the money with no repairs done. Everyone should expect an estimate before expensive repairs are done so you can determine  if worth your money. When we picked up the second time it would not even run to get on trailer and we left the lawnmower for parts after we made payment. We expect to pay for labor for diagnosis for problem but not about throwing our money away on a problem that was going to cost more than a new one. A complete rip off in my opinion. If anyone uses them do yourself a favor and tell them to not touch anything before asking for an estimate on repairs. Too late for us but if this saves someone else money it was worth this post!!!

name: Billy Maxwell
text:
,        BUYER BEWARE!!!!!

Last May I purchased a commercial zero turn, commercial chain saw as well as the commercial hedge trimmer. I told the owner I wanted a suspension seat and he told me if I would buy, he would throw the seat in but he had to make sure he had the seat ..i was then told he had it. I purchased the items and was told to let him know when I could bring it back to have the seat put on. He told me he would need a week to get it mounted. i was helping a friend in the area and carried it by early Monday morning and that's when this guys true colors started showing. I passed by there about three or four times (didn't stop) between Monday and Thurs just to see if it was being worked on but it NEVER MOVED!!! I called on Fri morning and told them I needed to come get my mower (meaning I needed to cut my 3 + acres of grass and bring it back on Monday but I did not say that) and the lady I spoke with said she would let him know. I get a call back in about 10 mins and the same lady informs me that he (the owner) said that if I came and got MY mower he would never put that seat on for me. Well after going around and around with husqvarna Corp. They got me set up with a real dealer that knows how to treat people ..i have to drive farther but I don't have to put up with this clown. To tell you what kind of character you will be dealing with, when I started dealing with the other company, they inform me there isn't a suspension seat for my Z554 in the entire husqvarna corporation because it is a brand new model. I wonder how this guy had one? It's a MIRACLE!!!! Also, on Friday when I picked my mower up the fuel gauge on the left hand tank was showing empty, tank was full but not showing it. I saw several very negative reviews on this place before I bought but like an idiot I bought from this....GUY anyway.
BIG MISTAKE!!!!! SAVE YOURSELF A LOT OF HEADACHES AND NEVER BUY ANYTHING FROM THIS GUY!!!!! HE ALSO OWNS THE STORE IN PELHAM!!! YOU'VE BEEN WARNED!!!!!

BUYER BEWARE!!!!!

text: My husband and I bought not just one but two little four wheelers for our kids,   I had been shopping g around d we got a fair price for them.  The reason for my one star, NO CUSTOMER SERVICE!  My kids wore down the brakes, I don't think they were hard on them, or our brake light is working.  We called while they were under warranty.  It took two weeks to get back about parts.  At that point the parts were out of warranty.  So we paid for them and shipping.  We got the wrong parts.  I even took picture the second time.  We got parts that look similar but size was wrong, would not work.  So Mailed them back along w one of the brake pads off the 4 wheeler and tracked them..  I found out that the package was delivered Thursday 4/28 .  I called and was told spouse was sick bit she sent picture to manufacture.  No call that we got them, they are working on it,, nothing.  This has been the way we have been treated.  You have to chase them down to get answers.  I asked to be called by the end of the week, with answers and a solution!  I haven't been able to ride our 4 wheelers since early March!  It's May 2nd!  It's not like we got these for free and didn't pay for replacement parts or shipping!

text: I ordered a starter for YM1700 on Wednesday afternoon. They shipped a new one to me and by noon the next morning it was on my tractor. The shop took me in and Jessie and Barry did a complete overhaul this morning and I was gone by noon. The tractor runs like a new one and looks a lot better too. All these guys are pros with a down home personality. It is great  to do business with a shop that cares about their customers. This tractor may outlast me and I may not get to see these guys much but you can be assured if I do need tractor work, this will be the place I turn to and I will recommend them to all my friends in need of their services.

name: Kim Bryant
text:
These guys and gals are great. The top notch customer service starts when you call about whatever you need. They will go above and beyond to help make your experience with them the best it can be.
I have a Bad Boy mower that I purchased at a chain store. When I needed blades for said mower, I had just watched their commercial. I called to see if they had what I needed in stock. They were getting a shipment at that exact time.
Normally a business will get the product on the shelf before they consider it in stock. These guys sent someone to get on the truck and find as many options for me as possible. They had every blade I could use. This was the first set of blades I had ever purchased. Instead of trying to "sell up", they taught me what each set was for. They wanted to make sure I was well informed on my blades. I asked them why and they said "Knowledge about your purchase will make you a better owner, and you will take better care of it because you now have skin in the game or so they say."
If you want the full  old timey correct customer experience, Fredricks is your place. If you just want to run in and run out, they are still your place. Because next time you go in, you will remember how they helped you to have a speedy checkout.
You will NOT be dissatisfied. This place is built for the experience.

resp.text: Wow, Kim. Thank you very much for your kind words! We'll always do what we can to serve our customers. It's a pleasure doing business with you!

text: I brought my old trimmer to SSE because it would crank but wouldn't fire. Long story short, it didn't have compression and it was going to take more to fix than the trimmer was worth. text: I found, during a telephone request for mower blades, the woman who answered the phone to be rude, un-cooperative, and completely unwilling to offer help.  She informed me that this store didn't sell blades for anything they  didn't sell and refused to even cross reference a part number even after saying that she could but was not going to.  I would never patronize this business.  I would walk even if going there would give me transportation.

resp.text: Sir, you were asking me about a Snapper blade, a blade that we do not carry.  I gave you the name of two other businesses that might be able to assist you.  If you want to talk about rude, you were very rude in DEMANDING that I cross reference a blade and give you a part number to a blade that we do not carry or order.   If you took anything that I said as rude, I apologize but I had 4 customers standing in front of me while I had the conversation with you and none of them felt I was rude.  It is very sad that you would leave a bad review for a company that has nothing to do with any product that they sell, service, warranty or anything else.

They told me that they had tried to call me repeatedly.  I went to the store and showed them my phone, where I had no calls from them.  I was then told "they must have mis-dialed".  I wasted a whole day staying near my home for delivery.  It was disrespectful and shows this location is unorganized.  I will do business with the Cullman location if I ever purchase from them again.

text: They are so rude, tried to tell me my pay off was 1200 more than it was. They will not tell you they add 800 dollars worth of insurance to your bill either, they will do it without asking. I have had my furniture not even 3 years and it's completely broken and has holes all in it. I paid over 5 thousand dollars for bascically garbage. Don't do it. Run away from this Place, you will thank me later!

name: Brytnie Boggs
text:
If you’re looking to finance furniture or anything in that sorts go to another furniture store and do it. Some place else’s furniture will be made better and I bet their customers service is so much better also.

They have deleted my other review about things being fixed from previously. The manager at the time did fix the problem. But I made a stupid mistake by buying something else that was more exspensive thinking it would be better, now they don’t want to fix that again a few months back. On top of that I completely forgot to come in and make November’s payments (normally someone would call me between the 1st and 10th just to remind me)(I’m a mother of two and full time college student so I’m forgetful when I don’t get reminders) they called me last week while I was sitting in class so I asked them to call me back in a couple of hours to discuss why they had called. Didn’t think nothing of it. Well today I got a letter in the mail saying I was avoiding them and refusing their calls (which I have not I answer every phone calll that comes in because I never know if something might have happened to someone) then the “new manager” tried to say she delivered this letter to my house today. This letter has a stamp on it has been through the post office lines and was in my mailbox at the bottom of the box(I haven’t checked my mail in three days so it was full) but she proceeds to tell me that my account which as of today is 30days late it wasn’t 30days late when she sent this letter to me. That she would be sending it to the court house this week. And that she would not work with me because I’m 30days late as of today. That this was policy after 30 days. I worked at this store in 2017 for a while and they normally don’t send to collection until 120 days or later. She also tried to tell me they have been calling I have not received but that one call from them a little over a week ago when I asked them to call me back and they never did then my grandmother received a call from them last night and she told me today when she seen me. So hearing this plus receiving this letter today I did call them only to be told she wouldn’t work with me. I also know that when I worked there and I would help the collector there to make calls you can just click in the computer saying that you called when really you didn’t. I told her I wouldn’t be able to pay her right now Christmas is a few weeks away my sons birthday is also the week of Christmas and my car payment is due this week so I offered to pay November and December’s payment on December 28th the Friday right after the holidays she then told me I would have to pay court cost and do it that way because my account wouldn’t be there any longer.

I have been dealing with farmers for a couple of years now and I always pay my accounts off wayyy earlier than need to be.
This is also the first time I have ever been more than two days late on making a payment. I understand they want their money, but sometimes things don’t work out like that so they should really work with someone who has never been late like that. When I was employed there you still got worked with at 120 days out. It didn’t matter how late you were if they could work with you they would.

I bought a new washer & dryer set from Handy's yesterday. The sales person was very polite, very professional, wasn't pushy at all but informative (which to me is very important). Prices were great as well.
The delivery guys showed up today, Jim & James. Both were incredibly nice, very professional & knowledgeable. They worked hard to install both appliances. My laundry space is very small & it was a bit difficult to maneuver but they did so without complaint at all.
I would definitely recommend Handy TV for any needs & I plan to use them for anything I may need in the future as well. James & Jim went above & beyond expectations. An overall amazing experience on all fronts!

resp.text: Hi Erica!  Thanks so much for shopping at Handy TV-Appliance! We are delighted to hear that you had such great experiences, both in the store and with your delivery!   I will pass along your compliments to Jim and James.  Please don't hesitate to ask if there is anything we can do for you in the future.  We look forward to seeing you again soon!

Bryan Scott

text: Took cub cadet in to have plastic fan on right transmission repaired. Decided to get tune up since it would be there. Was told a week for repair and tune up. 15 days later got it back. Service manager said all work was on sale at 10% off. Tune up was $160 .  Replaced 2 spark plugs,oil,fuel  and air filter plus oil. Rediculous charge. Fan was $30 and labor for complete job wad $260.80. Once again rediculous. Car dealers are not this exspensive. On top of that first time i cut grass the left mower spindle is bad. Had no issues with it before. Big time rip off. Never go there again. Kept it 15 days for 3.26 hrs of work. No im sorry or anything. Done with them. They charge $80 an hr. to work on a lawn mower.

The water refill tube the Home Depot employee opened for us to test, and sold to us, fit perfectly & solved our problem.
We also purchased our holiday tree & holiday greenery at this location.  Nick, the helpful young man that trimmed & wrapped the tree for us, did a perfect job. We have lived in a variety of cities and states and this is hands down our favorite Home Depot location.

Are you under staffing this store, or are the employees hiding in the back?  I will say that I mostly come to this store after 5pm usually.

I thought it was important to let you know this because if things do not improve, I will just go across the street to Lowe's where they have always been more than happy to help me.  Your store is my neighborhood store, and I want to see you succeed and not go under because of poor management decisions with either hiring bad employees or not paying your staff enough to care about the customers.

Thanks!

name: Emily Hanson
text: If I could give this place a zero I would! I have never even done reviews because it really depends on the day and person every where but this place is HORRIBLE!! First me and my husband bought an entertainment center and had to send it back 3 times for being damaged. The last time there was damage but you couldn’t see it that bad so we just kept it. We should have learned our lesson then!! The next time we bought our daughter a new bedroom suit and we bought a new kitchen table. We knew it was on back order for the bedroom suit but the table would be in sooner. We were called when the table came in set up the delivery time. On the day of Delivery for the table our time was 2-5, at 5 when we had not heard anything I called the store. They gave me a number to call the delivery guys because they said they couldn’t get ahold of their delivery guys. I’m not sure how a customer was supposed to get ahold of the delivery guys before the actually store but I called anyways. Of course no answer. Called the store again and the manager just kept telling me he didn’t know and to have my husband call him. Why do you need to speak with my husband when I’m the one calling?? My husband called and we were finally told they found the truck but we need to reschedule the drop off! Nope we will not we need it today! Me and my husband went to the store and picked it up. We chalked it up to understaffed due to covid and left it at that although still upset the manager will not talk to me only my husband. Now for TODAY! Manger called my husband (although he has my number) told him all the furniture would be in on Tuesday. Rather then wait around on another pointless delivery fail we said we would go in today on Thursday to pick up the furniture. My husband goes in and…. The manager said the furniture is not there and they can’t find it….. WHAT?!?!? Are you kidding me?!?!? My husband calls me at work at this point I’m done I’m furious I call up there to see what’s going on and the manager says YOUR TO UPSET I CANT TALK TO YOU! I WILL ONLY SPEAK WITH YOUR HUSBAND!!!  I have to call my husband (because I’m at work and can’t go up there and deal with it in person like I would like to) he has to call the store. Blah blah they offered him the furniture on the floor but the dresser is cracked! Are you kidding me no I’m not taking a cracked dresser after all this nor would I take it before all of this.He tells my husband he can come get the bed and nightstand we will have to wait on the dresser of course . We said since that is our only option it will have to do but we will NEVER AND I MEAN NEVER buy from this store and I’m going to corporate about all that has happened and how the manager here has a problem with speaking to woman!!

name: James Gatlin
text:
I brought in two motorcycles, one had a good motor and the other a blowed motor. I asked that he put the good motor on the good bike. We had a gentleman's agreement that I would pay more than a thousand dollars, and that would include two new tires. After looking closer at the tires I had I found that I had two good tires between the two bikes. I tried calling to check on the progress on my bike, but wasn't able to speak with anyone. Phill, the owner tells me, when I went in to check on my bike, that they got trash in my carbs. He had the carbs off my bike and was supposedly cleaning them. When he called me and told me my bike was ready I picked it up and only two cylinders was firing, the clutch was slipping, and the carbs were pouring gas. I took it back  the same day under the 30 day warranty to have it properly fixed. When he called me that my bike was ready and I went to pick it up he tries to charge me another $350.00. I called the police out to try and get my bike, but they said they couldn't get invovled and I would have to pay the money or get an attorney. I didn't trust him to leave my bike any longer, so paid the money to get my bike. My bike is sitting in my yard with the carbs still flooding out. After more than $1,400 dollars spent and I still can't drive my bike. If you value your property, do not take it to Prattville power sports. I'm getting an attorney and going to court.

Today June 4, 2019, I had the pleasure of meeting the new owners of Prattville power sports. I had bought a new battery from phill when he done the work on my bike. Today I found out that the battery he put in my bike wasn't the same battery he said he put in. That it was a cheaper version, but he charges me for the more expensive battery. The new owner pulled out the old bills and showed me the difference and then gave me the battery that I was suppose to have from the beginning. I now believe and tmhave complete trust in the new owners and plan to do my business with them now that I know phill is gone. Thank you Prattville power sports.

name: G M
text:
Horrible Service Department!
After numerous attempts to get the service department on the phone, I finally got through and unfortunately decided to drop off my mower for repair.  A week and a couple follow-up calls later, they still don't know what is wrong with my mower.  A couple days later, I'm told it's the auto choke in the carb although there is a choke on the handle.  A few days later, they are still waiting on the Honda parts rep to call them back.  Next day, I'm promised an estimate; I hear nothing.  I call the next business day (Monday) when I'm told i will have an estimate by the end of the day, but I told them if I didn't hear back that afternoon (2+ weeks later), I was picking my mower and not paying the diagnostic fee.  Do you think I got a call?  Nope.  At least they're consistent. I picked up the broken mower the next day without paying.  I would avoid this place, for service, like the plague.

Also of note, they do not use computers to document your equipment's problem, part number, or your contact info; they use a small notebook.  While I'll appreciate simplicity, I expect a business to be organized--not this service department!

If I could give zero stars or even negative, since my mower carburetor gasket was ripped during diagnostics, I would.

name: adam weber
text:
So on 11 Aug 18 I bought a JD riding mower (E100) from Lowes. Prior to this I physically visited SunSouth to purchase a mower but was told that I would need to go to a place like Lowes or Home Depot. I used my mower 3 times and noticed that the engine was leaking oil. On 29 Sep (when I noticed the leak), I called Lowes since I also purchased an extended warranty. They said that they would have someone come out to pick it up and that they would call the day before they were supposed to pick it up (scheduled for today 4 Oct) and give me a time. They were also supposed to call the day of pick up to let me know they were on the way.

Still haven't received a phone call and it it currently 4:21 pm. They close at 5 pm. My wife called Lowes back today at about 3:40 pm and they said they would contact them again and if we didn't hear from them that Lowes would call someone else.

Needless to say, I am NOT happy at all. I don't know about all of the other experiences, but so far mine is terrible. I will update if I get a call. Hopefully they can redeem themselves and get more than one star. I would give 0 stars if that were an option right now.

text:
Update on my previous review: Management finally returned my call. She was out sick since New Year's. She made our purchase good and replaced the damaged furniture. However, I am going to leave the initial review below this update, and raise the stars to a 3 instead of 1. This store really needs to evaluate their customer service skills and improve by taking care of issues in a timely manner.
Initial Review:
Horrible experience! Do not shop here! They sold us defective furniture that damaged our hardwood floors and no-one returns the calls. The delivery men were still at my house when I showed them the sofa was reclining and digging into the floors! The sofa reclined and left a deep two-foot-long scratch in our new hardwood floors. They replaced the sofa on Dec 31 and I showed them the loveseat is lopsided. They tried to fix it but couldn't. It has been over three weeks and these people do not return your calls nor stand behind their products! Don't shop here! I wish I had read these reviews before we shopped with Farmers! We are going to buy new bedroom furniture and a new refrigerator, but not from farmers!
